00027 //******************************************************************
00028   inline uiThread ui_beginthreadex(unsigned(__stdcall *f)(void *), void* p) {
00029     #ifdef _MT
00030       return (uiThread)_beginthreadex(NULL,0,(unsigned(__stdcall *)(void *))f, p, 0, 0);
00031     #else
00032 //      #pragma message( "Singlethread application")
00033       f(p);
00034       return 0;  // single thread if th==0
00035     #endif
00036   };
00037   // Wait until thread terminates
00038   inline void ui_waitthread(uiThread thread)  {
00039     #ifdef _MT
00040       if(thread==0) return;
00041       WaitForSingleObject(thread, INFINITE);
00042       CloseHandle(thread); // Destroy the thread object
00043     #endif
00044   };
00045   #ifdef _MSC_VER
00046   #pragma warning( push )
00047   #pragma warning( disable : 4311  ) // warning C4311: 'Typumwandlung': Zeigerverkuerzung von 'void *' zu 'unsigned int'
00048   #endif
00049   inline void ui_endthreadex(void * retval) {
00050     #ifdef _MT
00051      _endthreadex((unsigned int)retval);
00052     #endif
00053   };
00054   #ifdef _MSC_VER
00055   #pragma warning( pop )
00056   #endif
00057 //******************************************************************
00058   inline uiMutex ui_mutex_init() { return CreateMutex (NULL, FALSE, NULL);};
00059   inline int ui_mutex_lock  (uiMutex mutex) { return WaitForSingleObject(mutex,INFINITE);};
00060   inline int ui_mutex_unlock(uiMutex mutex) { return ReleaseMutex       (mutex); };
00061   inline void ui_mutex_destroy(uiMutex mutex) { CloseHandle(mutex); };
00062 
00063   };   //namespace MConf
00064 
00065 
00066 #else                        // POSIX threading
00067   #include <pthread.h>
00068 
00069   namespace MConf {
00070 
00074 //******************************************************************
00075   inline uiThread ui_beginthreadex(void *(*f)(void *), void* p)
00076   {
00077     uiThread th;
00078     //pthread_attr_t attr;
00079     //pthread_attr_init(&attr);
00080     //pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&attr, PTHREAD_CREATE_JOINABLE);
00081     //int rc = pthread_create((pthread_t*)&th, &attr, f, p);
00082     //pthread_attr_destroy(&attr);
00083     int rc = pthread_create((pthread_t*)&th, NULL, f, p);
00084     return rc==0?th:0;  // error if th==0
00085   };
00086   // Wait until thread terminates
00087   inline void ui_waitthread(uiThread thread)  {
00088     if(thread==0) return;
00089     pthread_join(thread, NULL);
00090   };
00091   inline void ui_endthreadex(void *retval) { pthread_exit((void *)retval); }
00092 //******************************************************************
00093   inline uiMutex ui_mutex_init()
00094   {
00095     uiMutex t=new pthread_mutex_t;
00096     if(t) {
00097       if(pthread_mutex_init(t,NULL)!=0) { delete t; t=0;}
00098     }
00099     return t;
00100   };
00101   inline int ui_mutex_lock  (uiMutex mutex) { return pthread_mutex_lock  (mutex); };
00102   inline int ui_mutex_unlock(uiMutex mutex) { return pthread_mutex_unlock(mutex); };
00103   inline void ui_mutex_destroy(uiMutex mutex)
00104   {
00105     if(mutex==0) return;
00106     pthread_mutex_destroy(mutex);
00107     delete mutex;
00108   }
00109 
00110 };   //namespace MConf

00114 namespace MConf {
00115 
00116 //****************************************************************************
00117 //
00118 // mutex is not provided; user must create it in caller routines if needed
00119 template <class T> class Threads
00120 {
00121   typedef  void(T::*TExeFun)(int i1, int i2, bool setup);
00122   T *obj;   
00123   TExeFun Exe;
00124   std::string thName;
00125   void setup__(int i1, int i2) {
00126     (obj->*Exe)(i1, i2,true); // call the member function of the obj
00127   }
00128   void execute__(int i1, int i2) {
00129     (obj->*Exe)(i1, i2,false);
00130   }
00131   struct Args {Threads *that; int i1, i2; };
00132   static uiThreadFunc EntryPoint(void *A)
00133   {
00134     Args *arg  =(Args*)A;
00135     Threads *that = arg->that;
00136     int i1 = arg->i1;
00137     int i2 = arg->i2;
00138     delete arg;
00139     that->execute__(i1, i2);
00140     ui_endthreadex(0);
00141     return 0;
00142   }
00143 public:
00144   Threads(T *ob, TExeFun exe, const char* name=0) : obj(ob), Exe(exe) {if(name) thName=name;}   
00145   virtual ~Threads() {;}
00146   // 
00147   void run(int low, int upper, int nThreads) 
00148   { 
00149     //nThreads = nThreads<=0?2:nThreads;    // number of threads
00150 #ifdef WIN32
00151     #ifndef _MT
00152     nThreads = 1;   //must be singlethread application
00153     #endif
00154 #endif
00155     const int NPPT = 5;  //min number of points per thread
00156     setup__(low, upper);  
00157     if(nThreads<=1) { execute__(low, upper); return; }
00158     int size = upper-low+1;
00159     int nppt = size/nThreads;         // number of points (per thread) to be handled by one thread
00160     if(nppt<=NPPT)  nThreads=size/NPPT;
00161     if(nThreads<=1) { execute__(low, upper); return; }
00162     nppt = size/nThreads;
00163     nppt = (nppt<=0)?1:nppt;
00164     //nppt = nThreads==1?size:nppt; 
00165     std::vector<uiThread> hThreads;   // to keep handles of threads
00166     int iTh = -1;
00167     for(int i1=low,i2=0; ;) {
00168       iTh++;
00169       i2 = i1+nppt;
00170       i2 = i2>upper?upper:i2;
00171       Args *arg = new Args;
00172       arg->that = this;
00173       arg->i1 = i1;
00174       arg->i2 = i2;
00175       uiThread th = ui_beginthreadex(EntryPoint,(void*)arg);      
00176       if(th==uiThread(0)) {    // if thread is not started 
00177         execute__(i1, i2);
00178         delete arg;        
00179       }
00180       else {
00181         hThreads.push_back(th); 
00182         TESTPRINT( std::cerr<<thName<<" starts the thread #"<<iTh<<" with handle="<<th<<":  for(i="<<i1<<";i<="<<i2<<";i++) {...}"<<std::endl<<std::flush ) ;
00183       }
00184       i1 = i2+1;
00185       if(i1>upper) break;
00186     }
00187     TESTPRINT( std::cerr<<std::endl<<std::flush ) ;
00188     for(int j=0; j<(int)hThreads.size(); j++)  
00189       ui_waitthread(hThreads[j]);    // Wait until threads terminate
00190   }
00191 };

00195 // the following is the example of how to use class Threads
00196 
00197 //****************************************************************************
00198 // this class implements multithreading for coordinate transformation 
00199 using MConf::Vector3d;
00200 using std::vector;
00201 class Mag2cyl {
00202   C3dMesh * mconf;
00203   vector<Vector3d> * cyl;
00204   const vector<Vector3d> * mag;
00205   uiMutex mutex;
00206   int numThreads;
00207 public:
00208   Mag2cyl(C3dMesh *mc,const vector<Vector3d> *m,vector<Vector3d> *c) 
00209            :mconf(mc), cyl(c), mag(m) {};
00210 
00211   void calculate(int nThreads) {
00212     numThreads = nThreads;
00213     Threads<Mag2cyl> threads(this, &Mag2cyl::calculateEx);  
00214     int low = 0, upper = int(mag->size()-1);
00215     mutex = ui_mutex_init();
00216     threads.run(low, upper, nThreads); 
00217     ui_mutex_destroy(mutex);
00218   }
00219 
00220   void calculateEx(int low, int upper, bool setup)
00221   {
00222     if(setup) {  // setup part; it allocates arrays if needed
00223       int size = upper-low+1;
00224       cyl->resize(size);
00225     }
00226     else
00227     {  // exe part; it will be called from threads to fill arrays
00228       C3dMesh *mcf = mconf;
00229       if(numThreads>1) {
00230         mcf = new C3dMesh;
00231         ui_mutex_lock(mutex);  
00232         *mcf = *mconf;        // need a new copy of C3dMesh to be thread safe
00233         ui_mutex_unlock(mutex);
00234       }
00235       C3dMesh &mc = *mcf;
00236       
00237       vector<Vector3d> &cyl = *(this->cyl);
00238       const vector<Vector3d> &mag = *(this->mag);
00239       
00240       for(int i=low; i<=upper; i++) {
00241         cyl[i] = mc.mag2cyl(mag[i]);     
00242       }
00243       if(numThreads>1) delete mcf;
00244     }
00245   }
00246 
00247 };
00248 
00249 // in main programm
00250 
00251   C3dMesh mc;
00252   vector<Vector3d> m;
00253   vector<Vector3d> c;
00254   Mag2cyl m2c(&mc, &m, &c);
00255   m2c.calculate(numOfThreads);
00256 
00257 #endif
00258 
00259 template < class T, class TR > class Threads2
00260 {
00261   typedef  void(T::*TExeFun)(TR *objR, int i1, int i2, bool setup);
00262   struct Args {Threads2 *This; TR *objR; int i1; int i2; uiMutex mutex; };  
00263 public:
00264   Threads2(T *ob, TExeFun exe, TR *oRHS,const char* name=0) : obj(ob), Exe(exe), objR(oRHS) {if(name) thName=name;}  
00265   virtual ~Threads2() {;}
00272   void run(int low, int upper, int nThreads, int NPPT=5) // low<=upper
00273   { 
00274 #ifdef WIN32
00275     #ifndef _MT
00276     nThreads = 1;   //must be singlethread application
00277     #endif
00278 #endif
00279     int size = upper-low+1;
00280     if(size<=0) return;  // indexes must be in ascending(increasing) order
00281     if(NPPT<1) NPPT = 1;
00282     if(size<=NPPT)  { setup__(objR,low, upper); execute__(objR,low, upper); return; }  //if1
00283     if(nThreads<=1) { setup__(objR,low, upper); execute__(objR,low, upper); return; }  //if3
00284     if(nThreads>size) nThreads=size;                                                   //if4
00285     int nppt = size/nThreads; // nppt>=1, number of points per thread, to be handled by one thread
00286     //here: NPPT >= 1, size > NPPT , 2 <= nThreads <= size, nppt >= 1 
00287     if(nppt<NPPT)  nThreads=size/NPPT+1; // here nThreads >= 2, see comment //if1
00288     nppt = size/nThreads;
00289     if(nppt==0) nppt=1;
00290     nppt--;
00291     int nTh = 0;
00292     for(int i1=low,i2=low-1; ;) {  // calculate nTh - number of theads
00293       i1 = i2+1;   
00294       if(i1>upper) break;
00295       i2 = i1+nppt; 
00296       i2 = i2>upper?upper:i2;
00297       nTh++;
00298     }
00299     setup__(objR,low, upper);
00300     TR &oR = *objR;
00301     std::vector<TR> oRc(nTh,oR);  // vector of clones
00302     std::vector<Args> args(nTh);  // vector of Args
00303     std::vector<uiThread> hThreads;   // to keep handles of threads
00304     mutex = ui_mutex_init();
00305     for(int i1=low,i2=low-1,ith=0; ith<nTh; ith++) {
00306       i1 = i2+1;   
00307       if(i1>upper) break;
00308       i2 = i1+nppt; 
00309       i2 = i2>upper?upper:i2;
00310       Args *arg = &args[ith];
00311       arg->objR = &oRc[ith];   
00312       arg->This = this;
00313       arg->i1 = i1;
00314       arg->i2 = i2;
00315       arg->mutex = mutex;
00316     }
00317     for(int j=0; j<nTh; j++) {
00318       Args *arg = &args[j];
00319       uiThread th = ui_beginthreadex(EntryPoint,(void*)(arg));      
00320       if(th==uiThread(0)) {    // if thread is not started 
00321         execute__(arg->objR,arg->i1, arg->i2);
00322       }
00323       else {
00324         hThreads.push_back(th); 
00325         TESTPRINT( std::cerr<<"'"<<thName<<"' starts the thread #"<<j<<" with handle="<<th<<":  for(i="<<arg->i1<<";i<="<<arg->i2<<";i++) {...}"<<std::endl<<std::flush );
00326       }
00327     }
00328     TESTPRINT( std::cerr<<std::endl<<std::flush ); 
00329     for(int j=0; j<(int)hThreads.size(); j++) ui_waitthread(hThreads[j]);    // Wait until threads terminate
00330     ui_mutex_destroy(mutex);
00331   }
00332 private:
00333   T *obj;   
00334   TR *objR; // will be used to create clone for using at right hand side in expressions inside TExeFun()     
00335   TExeFun Exe;
00336   uiMutex mutex;
00337   std::string thName;
00338   void setup__(TR *objR,int i1, int i2) { (obj->*Exe)(objR,i1, i2,true); } // call the member function of the obj
00339   void execute__(TR *objR,int i1, int i2) { 
00340     ui_mutex_unlock(mutex);  //std::cerr<<"thread for "<<i1<<"<=i<="<<i2<<std::endl<<std::flush;
00341     (obj->*Exe)(objR,i1, i2,false); 
00342   }
00343 
00344   static uiThreadFunc EntryPoint(void *A)  {
00345     ui_mutex_lock(((Args*)A)->mutex);  
00346     ((Args*)A)->This->execute__(((Args*)A)->objR, ((Args*)A)->i1, ((Args*)A)->i2);
00347     ui_endthreadex(0);
00348     return 0;
00349   }
00350 };

00353 // the following is the example of how to use class Threads2
00354 //****************************************************************************
00355 // this class implements multithreading for coordinate transformation 
00356 #include "../../MConf/include/C3dMesh.h"
00357 using MConf::Vector3d;
00358 using std::vector;
00359 //class C3dMesh;
00360 class Mag2cyl {
00361   C3dMesh * mconf;
00362   vector<Vector3d> * cyl;
00363   const vector<Vector3d> * mag;
00364 public:
00365   Mag2cyl(C3dMesh *mc,const vector<Vector3d> *m,vector<Vector3d> *c) : mconf(mc), cyl(c), mag(m) {};
00366 
00367   void calculate(int nThreads) {
00368     Threads2<Mag2cyl,C3dMesh> threads(this, &Mag2cyl::calculateEx, mconf, "Mag2cyl");  
00369     int low = 0, upper = int(mag->size()-1);
00370     threads.run(low, upper, nThreads); 
00371   }
00372 
00373   template <class mconf> void calculateEx(mconf * mc,int low, int upper, bool setup)
00374   {
00375     if(setup) {  // setup part; it allocates arrays if needed
00376       int size = upper-low+1;
00377       cyl->resize(size);
00378     }
00379     else
00380     {  // multithreading exe part; it will be called from threads to fill portion [low - upper] of arrays
00381        // mc is one from mconf clones for this portion
00382       vector<Vector3d> &cyl = *(this->cyl);
00383       const vector<Vector3d> &mag = *(this->mag);    
00384       for(int i=low; i<=upper; i++) {
00385         cyl[i] = mc->mag2cyl(mag[i]);     
00386       }
00387     }
00388   }
00389 
00390 };

00394   #include "../../MConf/include/C3dMesh.h"
00395   MConf::C3dMesh mc;
00396   using MConf::Vector3d;
00397   using std::vector;
00398   Vector3d magcoord(.25,1.,2.); 
00399   vector<Vector3d> m(100,magcoord); // vector with the same magcoord, just for example
00400   vector<Vector3d> c;               // empty vector, it will be filled
00401   Mag2cyl m2c(&mc, &m, &c);
00402   m2c.calculate(numOfThreads);      // transform nagnetic coordinates to cylindrical, c will be filled
